sentence.Network_en: He sits with a drawn cutlass.
sentence.Network_cn: 他现在坐在那里时,面前总是放着一把出鞘的弯刀.

sentence.Network_en: At the same time , observing Gray to be unarmed, I handed him my cutlass.
sentence.Network_cn: 突然, 我发现格雷没有武器, 便把我的弯刀给了他.

sentence.Network_en: Let me just find my silver cutlass, and fill my stomach!
sentence.Network_cn: 让我找到我的银短刀, 填饱我的肚子就好!

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from French coutelas, based on Latin cultellus 'small knife' (see cutler)

entry.def: A cutlass is a short sword that used to be used by sailors.

means.word_mean: 1. a short heavy curved sword with one edge; formerly used by sailors
